latex: Let $m$ be a positive integer, and let $T$ denote the set of all subsets of $\{1, 2, \dots, m\}$. Call a subset $S$ of $T$ $\delta$-\textit{good} if for all $s_1, s_2\in S$, $s_1\neq s_2$, $|\Delta (s_1, s_2)|\ge \delta m$, where $\Delta$ denotes the symmetric difference (the symmetric difference of two sets is the set of elements that is in exactly one of the two sets). Find the largest possible integer $s$ such that there exists an integer $m$ and $ \frac{1024}{2047}$-good set of size $s$.
